com.edit.reach.system

Class VehicleSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.edit.reach.system.VehicleSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class VehicleSystem
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class that represents a VehicleSystem. This class handles all communication with the AGA Signals. Created by: Tim Kerschbaumer Project: Milestone Date: 2014-09-27 Time: 19:28 Last Edit: 2014-10-29

    • Constructor Detail

      • VehicleSystem

        public VehicleSystem()
        Constructor. Creates a VehicleSystem and starts listening to signals from vehicle.

    • Method Detail

      • getDistractionLevel

        public int getDistractionLevel()
        This method returns the current distractionLevel. If it has not been set it returns -1.
        Returns:
        the distractionLevel of the driver.

      • getFuelLevel

        public float getFuelLevel()
        This methods returns the level of fuel left in tank in percent from 0 to 100.
        Returns:
        a float from 0-100 that represents the fuel level. -1 if fuelLevel not intialized.

      • getTimeUntilForcedRest

        public double getTimeUntilForcedRest()
        Method that returns the number of seconds until a stop is required.
        Returns:
        The legal uptime if currently in a break Positive number with seconds left if driving Negative number if drive longer than legal.

      • getTimeUntilRefuel

        public double getTimeUntilRefuel()
        Estimates how long until a refuel is recommended.
        Returns:
        how many km until a stop for fueling is recommended. Returns -1 if not applicable.

      • getVehicleState

        public int getVehicleState()
        Method that returns the current state of the vehicle.
        Returns:
        a constant int value representing the state of the vehicle.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
